content: Addictive Turn Based Strategy Game I first started playing this game many years, and phones, ago. Over the years it's been expanded and enhanced. The goal is to dominate a given map. The maps are rated from easy to very difficult. As you play them, you'll develop your own strategy and eventually win around 98% of them. What i like: NO ADS, play at your own pace, simple user interface. Easy to learn, years to master, all for just a couple bucks!
Had it many years ago on my iPaq pocket pc, loved it then, love it now, awesome game
I only want to play among us
Great fun little game.

Would be nice if cloud saving via Play Games was supported, missing some features from the ios version such as themes and more colors, and multiplayer on the same device, taking turns. Other than that simple concept. Keeps crashing when rotating to portrait or landscape, or when viewing help menus.
Keeps crashing mid-game every so often. Can't see why unfortunately. My phone is a LG Rebel 4

This game is amazing, would be a five but the new update closes the app all the time now. Makes it much slower to play. My phone registers it as a crash. Update, game still crashes. Is there no way to disable the vibrate on hold to March?
Love it! Used to play the desktop version years ago.
Classic PC gaming brought to mobile. What's not to like?
Good game but won't work on my phone

Excellent strategy game. Simple rules and no frills graphics mask an absolute gem. Gameplay so addicting that 5 minutes easily turns into an hour. "Just one more map" you'll tell yourself. But one more is never enough. I played this game back in the nineties on PC and was delighted to find it here. Don't miss out. Bonus: No ads or stupid loot boxes.

It's a really good concept and fun app (5/5) However, a number of issues really drag it down. If you rotate the screen, the app crashes. If you lock your device and unlock it, the app loses where you were. Additionally, if you happen to be holding a newly purchased piece while this happens, you lose the piece and the money. I don't think I would have purchased the game had I known of these issues
Loved this game, now it won't open on my new device (Mate20 Pro). (November 2018) Still does not work in 2020. Unfortunate because I paid for this app and really did enjoy it!
Great fun ... best game out there
Great game but unfortunately on my current phone (Huawei P20) it crashes immediately when opening, even after reinstallation.
Piquant. Domage

Unbelievably stacked against advanced play with castles the AI opponent lays down. Plus if you're not careful with ending your turn you lose points. I love a hard game vs, AI but this is ridiculous so I've uninstalled.
Love the game. Gets very challenging in later levels.
I used to put this on Windows years ago. It works really well on a tablet.

Yes, Hi! Thank you for this time passing and addictive strategy game. It fairly reminds me of the early 'Command and Conquer' games. I wish you could adjust difficulty for each map on Android. PLEASE!! : )

I played this game often on Windows years and years ago and forgot about it completely until it popped up on here. Absolutely my favorite game of this style. I have spend more time playing on here than I have on my new gaming laptop. Thank you so much for bringing this to Android.
Lots of fun
great game, but has lost my progress :(..5* update, save fixed

I love this game.. but i preferred windows version. (I play it since released.) I dont like sort A to Z map but not unplayable..... It will be Nice and improve replay value if there is random map creator.

I really enjoy this game, the problem is the iOS version is better because it has multiplayer features which are not present on this version, I also wish this game had a way to set the difficulty rather than have it arbitrarily set to the map, and play custom maps. I preferred the old PC version ( not the steam one the original) where I could do all these cool things. I have reccomended this game and a couple friends have bought it. Also please fix the crashes. This game has so much potential.
Love this game on PC but it doesn't run on my razor phone 2
Fun and simple, but challenging when you get into the higher difficulty levels.

I've played this game for years it's always kept me coming back it's got great bone mechanics. They're simple get too many trees on your land you don't get soldiers you clear the trees you have land to grow food which gives you men. And don't let the men outgrow the plot size if you don't have enough open land in the area of your army the Army will starve to death other words the game has a serious just rock paper scissors between the 4 rankings three soldiers and a castle By the way use castles
This is one of my go to games... Install, play, delete... Repeat. Great game.
Played this game for 20 plus years. Its fantastic but it needs more maps. Better yet, Port the full pc version and allow multiplayer!
Very good game. Fairly challenging but still possible.
I preferred the "oof" noise when taking out huts (versus the burning noise now), but this is still one of my favorite strategy games to date.
I cant load the game it just quit before loading the island and i cant play
Simple and addictive
Great game. Room for improvement, a classic is a classic.

I've played through this dozens of times on multiple platforms over the fifteen years or so. Each time I get a new device, I download this game. The first time I played was on a Palmpilot! It's still just as great (I've even seen quite a few look a like apps out there.)
Great strategy game, with just as strong AI on Mobile. I just wish it had the random and custom games of the initial Windows version!
I do enjoy this game, but the trees that unfairly overtake your entire lands and not your opponents' ruins the pace and casual nature of the game
Stellar performance. Been playing for years without a single problem or issue.
Fun stratigic
This game is the best!

This game has kept me coming back for years. Such a simple mix of rules and a good pace of play make this a great mobile game to pick up for a short gaming session. A huge amount of levels and difficulties keeps things interesting.
Great fun
Great little game. The only thing missing is the option to edit/create our own maps like you could do a few years back on Windows
had to re-buy android version. also android app seems to be several versions back from ios. on ios you can dounle tap on adjasent hex to buy-and-place.
Nice game but the AI is too easy
One of the best
Love this game since PocketPC. A nice and simple strategic board game suitable for mobile platform.
incredible app very fun to play. wish there was a map editor or crazy maps to buy
almost done with all the levels. Too bad it does not include random map generator.
one of my favorite games, but there is inexplicably no cloud save feature so if you get a new phone you lose everything

so only 2 stars just because of the fact that the game starts and stops randomly and doesn't seem to have been fixed by the android update at all or the Google play update so I'm wondering what is up? other that it's on of my most favorite strategie games I've been playing it since the windows 95 days and it's still one of the best

I've played this game for over 20 years back when it first was released as a PC shareware game. The mobile version is great. Simple yet engaging with hundreds of levels. Still havent even played half of them.
Between playing this since forever! I believe originally as part of some win95 shareware CD and the gameplay still hold up to this day. Never got to support it as a kid, not glad to be able to now.
A very addictive strategy game. Simple to learn and lots of fun. I've been playing this for years.
1.1.2 I love this game but it keeps resetting my progress. pls fix
great game. Reminds me of the old mine sweeper game

Uggh I don't want to give it only 3 starts, but it just wasn't ported that well. Cities aren't consistent when you join territories, and an annoying glitch keeps shifting the camera back to the left. Makes it pretty annoying just to get through one level. I love the PC version though.

classic game and great fun. but as some other comments have stated unfortunately it does crash, but that isnt the problem as it doesnt impact data or progress. But today for some reason i've lost my progress....REALLY FRUSTRATING as you feel like you've lost any sense of achievement. i'd suggest to try and integrate with google play so that data and scores can be stored beyond a corrupted app. a real shame as its a classic i played years ago too! please address the problems!!

would be an easy five star if it werent for the numerous game breaking bugs. it loses your score and forgets levels youve completed, making any feeling of accomplishment pretty void. it crashes every time you go away from the game. gave it 2 stars because of the great bones of the game. its really a shame and absolutely confusing how the ios version is so much more polished and less buggy.
This game is AWESOME!! I haven't put it down.

The game is great and I can't stop playing. Alas, if I have to stop for whatever reason- the game will inevitably crash on me. Going back to homescreen? Crash. Checking notificiations? Crash. Coming back from device-sleep? It crashed as well, this time without notification. How I know it crashed? I always looose the last unit i used. I sent a crash-report a couple of days ago, Since this problem only started recently, I do have some hope that this gets fixed (again).

I have played this game ever since  I had an Ipaq PDA, and then on Windows 95. I'm so glad Sean keeps updating it for the next generation of software and hardware. Sean is the original creator the rest of the apps that look like this one are copy cats.

Honestly a great game. Would be 5 stars, but unfortunately there is a major bug that causes it to forget that a level has been completed, or a score has been improved on. It appears to be related to using the home button, and I've also crashed it from pressing this before. Unfortunately this is as annoying as it sounds, but the workaround looks to be only using the back button during app use.
Great game, but if you tab out of the game while having an unit slected (or if the game crashes) that unit will not be saved on the map and is lost forever, valve please fix.
If you've got nostalgic memories of playing this game, go for it. There's a smattering of bugs here and there, but the developer seems responsive. Main downside is the price tag.
Love the game but lost my progress. Frustrating bug.

Wonderful game. I had this on pocket PC when it was called pocketslay, and I love this as a good way to pass the time when on a trip or just relaxing at home. My only wish is that there would be a way to set the graphics to the classic ones of the original.
It is a very nice and relaxing game
Incredibly fun and addictive gameplay. Well worth the cost. I've barely worked through three pages of maps and have many more hours of enjoyment left in this game.
The only mobile game I keep coming back to.

interface is not really optimized for mobile. also, doesnt properly restore after going to background. not only does it not save your place, but if you have unit selected it will forever be lost! bug basically ruins your game
love the game, however despite the recent update i still cannot run it on ios 9
Reinstall was required, but now the game runs smoothly on Android 9. One of the best strategies, playing it since WinMobile Dell handheld.
replyContent:
Hi Ilia,

I have release a new version that fixes the Android 9.0 issue.

Please try again.

Thanks

Adrian

Adrian

content: Great game
played the game on PC, love it. App version crashes on launch. would love a bug fix for this. update: the patch is working. thanks!
replyContent:

Version 1.1.2 has been released and should be available soon.  It should fix the Android 9.0 issue, please try again.

content: Great game and the dev is very responsive and friendly :)
Update 1.1.2 still doesn't work for Android 9.0. Love the game but I am disappointed the update still didn't fix the app loading
Great game, recent patch broke pinch to zoom.

I very "RARELY" give five stars for any app or game but I've been playing this game since before it was ported from windows 98 to android. It's a great static strategy game like chess or checkers that you can save and come back to and was one of a set of 4 games. I just wish the developer would port his "rats" game to android as well, as that was not only great to play but had pretty hilarious sounds too. (BLEARGH!)
come out with slay 2 already !
It used to crash on launch, but the developer is a great guy, and fixed it. cheers man, it's all working now :)

content: love this game, the new fix solved the problems as far as i can tell, thnx for the fast response!
I first found Slay when it was within PlayStation Home as part of Dust and I've been addicted ever since. I can not recommend it enough. Outstanding Thank you

Adrian.

fast responce by dev. great game.
wasn't able to run on my pixel 3, refunded but would love to play and willing to buy again. wow awesome response time, looking forward to playing. thanks

content: Fun, but the trees seem a little overbearing. Even with 10+ units running around clearing them, I couldnt race the spawnrate.

***Update: Sounds like Sean is on it. He is on his Android dev who is testing an Android 9 update and it sounds like he's close to a patch version. 2 Stars now for the quick response. content: I've been playing Slay since I was a kid. It is perfect on the mobile platform. Very fun strategy game with a ton of levels. Only complaints I have are in regards to a mobile feature and the sounds. The 'hold to march' feature is really nice when I have a lot of units but the problem is that the map scrolls when I try to hold down on a space. I like to have sounds on but sounds overlap. It would be nice to have the ability to disable select sounds because I can't hear the victory horns.
Crashes immediately on Android 9. Hopefully can get an updated version that doesn't crash but I'm stuck for now. No option to refund. Happy to test if there's a new version.

content: i would love to see a multiplayer feature added
Best off line game ever! played it for years. wish I could add more maps though.
Always loved this game.
All in all you can't go wrong with this game
Perfect port of a PC classic

The best turn based strategy game I've ever played, after Master of Magic (DOS emulator req.) Deceptively simple at first glance, this game is addictive to the point that my boyfriend is worried about me. Him: 'Are you playing that game with the little men AGAIN?' Me: 'you're gd right I am'. Plus, I can play for like three hours on my tablet w/ 4% battery left. Continues to challenge you thru hundreds of hours of gameplay. Fabulous game.
Have played this game for decades, so glad to find it here!
Waiting for Slay 2 or some new levels and features.
looking forward to updates
Been playing since 1995, incredibly engaging for such a simple game.
Great game.

Slay is and has always been one of the greatest most solid games ever made. 
I remember playing it on my dad's pocketpc years ago as a kid and love it 
no less now as an adult.
Great game
I remember playing this when I was a kid
I am a long time Sean O:Connor fan, but I am sorry I bought this game on Android.  Budget management is critical to winning, but budget info is not provided.

I often play the old WinCE version on a touch HD with a stylus that I keep mainly for this game.   Bought this when the author sent me a email from a previous enquiry on its availbility.   This game is prettier and is more user friendly, yet I have been left unsatisfied.  I'd only play the game on the hardest settings on WinPE as that was the only level providing some sort of challenge. I am finding the Andriod version of the game on its hardest settings too easy and therefore I am quite disappointed. Sean - good work, but you need to make the AI better... I don't want to win every game.
Simple, elegant, well balanced
Great game, wish there was some form of multiplayer though. AI could be more difficult but a great, fun game nevertheless.

Recommended!  Simple game with decent escalating difficulty and solid strategy elements.  Elegantly simple interface and easy to grasp, but hard to master.  Simplicity can be a double-edged sword, since gets a bit repetitive after awhile.  Dev - defend your IP against copycat game Antiyoy, it's a shameless copy

Been playing this game for well over a decade after playing a free version on an old shareware compilation disc. Having gotten literal years of enjoyment out of those, I'm actually stoked to finally give Sean some money for an awesome game I've loved for years
Great range of challenge and strategy.

Unfortunately the app crashes in newer versions of Android. The developer had been unresponsive and no update has been provided in years. Probably don't buy this app if you have a newer phone. It likely won't work.
Best wee waste of time there is.
Simple game. Addictive. Great time waster.

Great concept, atrocious level design. Success is predetermined by base locations at the start of a game. Some levels are stacked so badly that I just skip the map. There needs to be an update for smarter base placement. A simple algorithm can fix this issue.
Loved slay for years, super glad it has become available on mobile. Accidentally stumbled on a few illigitamate ports such as antiyoy while looking for this.
I still have the original on pc and this version is disappointing, limited next for maps and  difficulty is locked to maps.
Anyone having problems playing this on marshmallow or on nougat? Can't get this game working on any device I have or had in the last couple of years.
Finally on Android!

iOS version is much better. Here, difficulty is tied to the map and the AI is not nearly as challenging. Somehow the graphics are worse? Tooltips are super annoying at the beginning of the round and can't be turned off.   Overall, feels like a cheap, rushed port. Too bad, because Slay is a great game.
Been playing this for years glad I found it again ... Still can't find your conquest one though
Super-tight mini strategy game. Seeing clones of it so wanted to drop in and give this one some love.
Memories of WinCE....
More maps! Also i used to have this on an ipad and it had a whole other layer of maps, easily three times the maps available for my android version, what gives?
Very good but not the highest  version
Great game... but I wish it was the newest version.
Only wish the difficulty was more flexible. Like, there are lots and lots of very hard maps, but I'd like more medium and hard. Would be nice if AI difficulty was independent of map layout.
Game is awesome, only thing it's missing is multiplayer

Honestly, this is an awesome game.  I enjoy playing it frequently to relax.  Even after owning it for a while I still come back to maps I've not won or to beat my best score.    I do wish it was like the iOS version where I can change the difficulty on each map.  Anyways, try the game, it's still great fun.

Impossible levels. If on the first play all u have is a few hex and trees, and the enemy has land the size of Africa, then the map is a fail, was randomly generated but never actually tested. Maps should be verified playable
Fun game! Please update it to be like the iOS version
Impossible levels.

Excellent strategy game.  I have put so many hours into this game in the years since I first installed it, and I've just finished *attempting* every level (88% win rate on Very Hard). It's definitely earned 5 stars from me!
This game works similar mental muscles to chess, but you control the pace. Quite a fun, satisfying experience, and there's so much content that it's well worth the price.

I played this ages ago and rediscovered kit via the Antiyoy - this is tougher. Hard levels take me multiple attempts to win and very hard levels are just frightening. It's been years since an update and it could do with some more user options, but this is definitely worth the money.

Like many others here, I too had the original PC version and it was fantastic. Simple yet complex gameplay.  If you like turn based strategy games, this is one of the best. Love the translation to mobile.
The ux isn't quite as good as that on the ipad, but still well worth 5 stars
Great, simply great
I've been playing this game since I first got it on a Windows PDA around 2001. Still amazing. Perfect for a 2 minute fix or a 1 hour binge!
Have been playing Slay on and off for the past 15 years. Perfect for short bursts.
Very well implemented risk like strategy game. One of the best strategy games on the market.

Are you feeling lucky, punk? If this game will run on your system it's a really outstanding game. Loved it. But - it stopped working on my previous smartphone (Note 3). I suspended judgement as I'd installed a custom ROM. But it won't run on my unmodified Moto G 2+ either so sorry I feel I need to say something. Last update was over 3 years ago so I doubt there will ever be a fix. Shame.

Love the game.  Very powerful opponent AI. Played antiyoy first as my introduction to the Slay format.  The Antiyoy AI couldn't withstand me though; it just wasn't smart enough.  The legit Slay (this one) is a whole different story.  You have to play careful and always be aware of your boards vulnerabilities.      The only cons, to me, are that the UI could be updated to be more polished, units should be color matched to the team they're on, and better representation of how much money you'll have next turn.
More awesome
Love Slay and Conquest from Sean! C'mon, bring Conquest to Android and I'll pay
I hate phone games. I love slay.
When you've spent a number of hours playing, most of the easy and very easy are beatable.. but there are the odd scenes that are close to impossible! Very frustrating as I don't like to be thwarted.
I love this game. Will happily spend hours playing this.
I started playing this game on Windows Mobile in 2010, and I still play it.

Such an original and compelling strategy game.  It isn't easy but not impossible.  Challenges the mind quite a bit, like playing chess and risk combined, but that description doesn't really do it justice.  Well done!  EDIT: Please, please add new Very Hard maps, or add a Random Map feature.
This is the only game I play constantly and never get bored of.
I hate stradegy games, this is my only exception. Very well done!
One of my all time favourite games and probably the best game on play store. It's easy to learn, difficult to master. Gotta love it.
I've had this game over several years and devices, and still love it.

Simple concepts yet deep applications. If you like tactical games I'd highly recommend this. BUG FOUND: when you select a unit to move and hit the back button (Android, not in game) the unit disappears.
Play the harder levels for a brain busting challenge... classic turn based geek fun. Would be nice if towns showed +/- supply so troops dont die
I've played this game for years...it never gets old for me.
I have played this game for about 15 years on many different platforms, and I never get tired of it.    Well worth the money.  I do wish it would get some of the updates from the windows version

I remember playing this game years ago, and I'm talking years.  It's absolutely amazing.  Plenty of levels, interesting concept... No game has transitioned to mobile so well.  Get it.  You won't regret it.
Classic game that you can't beat
It plays well on my Nexus 4.
..won't load on new HTC10 with Marshmallow
Simple yet so hard. Love it!
The menus work, but when I try to start a game I see the map and the it force closes before I can touch anything.
Loved this game a long time ago, and still play it!
Awesome game on iOS but android version won't run. App stops immediately after loading splash screen. Reinstalled, no difference.
I've played this game on various platforms for over 20 years and it is absolutely brilliant. Its simplicity is its key.
I play this game since decade ago on pc. I think I even spent considerable time playing over the demo level :D
very addictive
I really like this game, but the "very hard" levels get incredibly tedious. If you don't know what the PERFECT moves are for the first 5 or 6 rounds, it's almost impossible to win.
Yay!
Bought this for Windows, along with a package of other games, maybe 10 years ago. As good as I remember. Would love to get Conquest on Android. üòâ
Addicting, have played this for nearly two decades and still find it satisfying.

I first encountered this game on a friend's computer in the late 90s and promptly fell in love with it. It has held a special place in my heart for almost two decades now. Thanks for this irreplaceable piece of my childhood, Sean.
Great game, but I felt mocked when I realized that it is single player only! You can play only against AIs!

Like Othello, easy to learn, difficult to master. Simple yet engrossing, the game is entirely enjoyable for any turn-based strategy fans. While the application could certainly do with some polishing, the game is solid and absolutely worth the $3 and some-odd amount of change!
I have had this game on the pc years ago and i am so glad i have found it again.  Great tower strategy game well worth the money.
Very challenging, very fun, very addictive. Would have given 5 stars if there was an online version.

Was so happy to see this for Android!  I played many years ago on a Windows phone but didn't know it had been ported to Android.   Well worth the money if you want a simple to learn but difficult to master strategy game.   I just hope he's planning on bringing "Mother of All Battles" to Android soon!  I'd pay for that too!!
amazing! I would love a 'next' button to cycle between the remaining moves in the turn (of an unit or a capital) - in addition to the flashing red spots on the map
Lots of fun and a great concept
I always come back to this game.
I go through periods of playing it incessantly and not at all. It is a great game made better by touch.  Better on a bigger screen,  but pinch to zoom works.
Long time fan of this game on the PC, finally released for Android.  Losing your progress when task switching is frustrating for sure!
I have been playing this for many years on the PC.  Now I can play it everywhere.
Great game
Droid Ultra, KitKat
Simple but fun game that is just so easy to spend 10-15 minutes on.  I have had ig for years and regulary come back.
Love the strategy however can't leave a positive review as I originally played this game on iOS which has more features such as difficulty selection on a level-by-level basis.
A perfect  puzzle game
Very many difficulty levels and tons of maps. But I wish we could control the map size and settings and cpu players intelligence individually but even without that the game is incredible.
Within seconds of opening the game it crashes. The phones a OnePlus Two.
Beautifully simple yet complex enough for hours of replay value.
I wish there was multi player. Definitely worth the cost
I love this game but help! I've run out of islands! Please can you supply more maps (very very hard?) or perhaps make it possible to play the other players on the existing islands.
I'm extremely picky in mobile games, this one is very simple to learn and a lot of fun to play! It's like mine sweeper on Windows, ubiquitous and liked by pretty much everyone.
Runs well, great strategy, and an excellent premise. Highly recommended
Needs a setting where u can change number of players. Also needs harder difficulty. Very hard is a piece of cake

Found after play antiyoy a slay clone. This one is nice but needs real time troop cost and income while playing the bored. I find my self over spending and I don't want to play unless updated. Also lack of map editor a nice touch antiyoy has. Will 5 star with updates. Good game happy to pay but needs to be finished
Amazing strategy game. Pity about the weird UI.
Great way to spend time
Love this game,  pity that the other themes (alien etc) haven't been ported to Android.
Played this game for so many hours. Please bring Android the rest of your games! Specifically Critical Mass, Mother of, and firefight.
I played this years ago on pc, can't wait to see how it plays on phone.  This is a strategy game, graphics not needed. Othello/Risk style game, grow too fast, or not fast enough, you lose.
Great to get the game I enjoyed years ago on PC on my mobile.
Sean makes great games, been playing them for a decade on all platforms
Lots of levels takes a bit to figure it out but great game
my favorite to the public transport :-)
Played this for many years
Great game
Wish my units were a different color than enemy units. Wish I could deselect. Wish it were easier to see which cities can buy men. Wish it was smarter about telling me when my men can move.
Sean, so glad you got this over from pc version.  This is way better then risk.  Ive always loved slay.  Now I just can't wait until you do mother of all battles! (Nudge, nudge)
I had this on iOS and now on Android. The ai isn't that smart, but the disadvantages from certain maps make it worthwhile.
So simple, so great. Multiplayer would be cool, and sometimes it crashes, but otherwise I absolutely love this game. If anyone is wondering how to make mobile games, look at Slay.
Been playing on PC and tablet; this is just as much fun.
Finally, my DROID is complete.
Loved it on the PC and glad to find it on android. Buy it you won't be disappointed.
Fantastic and addictive strategy game. If you discovered this on the PC many years ago, you will be happy - great on the go game.

A great version of Slay.  No difficulty in transitioning from the Windows Slay, which I purchased years ago.  It's rare to have a game that you can play casually in bursts and still have deep strategy, and this is that game.  Interface is intuitive and the switch to touch input was well done. I highly recommend.

I had the shareware version of the game for Windows 95. I have been trying to get the full game ever since. I'll post a proper review later, but based solely on how much I played it back then I had to but it immediately.
I've played this over and over for more than a year now. Never get sick of it!
Slay is a great game.  Both Challenging and fun!  Wish there was an Android Demo Version that contained 1 Map so others would try it before spending $4
Couldn't play it at all..
Very addictive
When I was a kid. I love it.
Hard - Fogr is impossible to win! If anyone can beat this one please let me know as I've tried every possible way! I urge the developer to try and beat it! Not happy!
Perfectly executed UI and gameplay. Tons of maps to play. With proper marketting, the game can become a really huge thing. The potential is there.

Initially had a problem with the game actually loading...would open and then shut down straight away, which seems to have sorted itself out. Now the turns it took for me to win keep disappearing...which is massively annoying... would give a 5* rating because this game is brilliant.
This is surprisingly one of the best strategy games out there, and out of 100 or so mobile strategy games I've played, this is one of the few that I still go back to play after a year later.
Need more maps! Great game!

Slay is a great little game, that requires an interesting balance of greed and protecting your lands. Unfortunately, after just a few games, Slay becomes almost unlosable, and loses some of its zest. I've enjoyed my time with the game, but for a five star rating, it would need to have more active and aggressive ai, and more interesting maps -- maybe even a custom map maker.
I played this all the time when it was only for iOS. But now it's here for Android and I did not hesitate. Purchase on sight!
Doesn't seem to work on latest android version. Crashes when a map is opened. But used to be a great game!

One of my all-time favourites. I have been playing it on PCs for ten years but as it does not work on Win8 I am now largely limited to my Android devices. My daughter fell in love with it when she was 7 and has been playing it since. I still have access to a Win7 machine where I can play my custom maps - it would be nice to have this facility on the Android version too. Thanks Mr O'Connor for an excellent game of which I will never tire.

I was just trying to think of the little strategy game I had a demo of growing up on my first computer, did a quick Google and found this. Never had a chance to buy the original but it brought me so many hours of joy so I'm so happy to play this again and support the person who made it.
Most game I've played oh a phone ever.
Great game! Wish it had online mode like the PC version
Fantastic game but please can we have some bigger maps? Thanks!

Have purchased  this game for every platform I use. Usually first purchase. Straight forward . No in app purchase or any other cap.  No adverts . Does not need to be online . Perfect for killing 10 minutes here or there.
Force close
A great strategy game that is well worth the cost

Very addictive game, just unfortunately the game keeps crashing forcing me to restart the level from scratch.  Which seems to be happening more frequently.  Or possibly its because the harder levels are taking longer to do. Either way highly irritating.
Ill go back to 5 stars when this is fixed. Galaxy note 10.1, used to work fine.
Love this game but there are some sound issues when selecting a village
A rare strategy game that doesn't feel like a knock-off of anything else. Simple, elegant rules that lead to challenging play and a brutal AI.
Have played every map. Now replaying some just for fun. A couple of maps ive not been able to beat.
Two bug reports for today... 1. If a player holds game figure and exits, he/she loses that figure. 2. Sound. All activities should +/- media volume. At the moment, main flipper influences ringer.

I have been playing this game ever since i was in middle school.  I have it on my desktop right now.  I am not giving 5 stars because i do not get to pick my own color, the colors of the other players or how many people i can play against. 2 This version doest let me do that.  Sometimes all i want is 1 opponent.  Its not the same game.  I dont even get  to choose a human opponent.  I really LOVED the other version.  This one makes me miss it even more
Highly addictive - its like chess for people who can't be bothered with chess. Simple graphics, but a fantastic game.
The iPhone version is superior in terms of differentiating sides based on colours.. Otherwise it's great!
I've played this game on many platforms, starting from the venerable Windows Pocket PC days, and to this day it remains a masterpiece of turn-based strategy gaming. Highly recommended!
Loved this game since my Windows Mobile 6 days and happy to see it on Android.  Plays just like I remembered it.  A perfect little strategy game that offers a challenge but never feels cheap.
Loved playing this on windows, my fond memories of this great game, still holds true.   Classic game play, hold up against anything available in the market today.
Played this on its worth every penny hours of entertainment
Dont read this, just SLAY.
I played through all very easy, easy, and all hard maps.  Very hard maps, will actually give you a real challenge.  This is not p2w, it's all about skill.

A very simple yet highly addicting turn-based strategy game. With simple, straightforward rules & simple, pleasant graphics, the emphasis is on pure strategy. Very enjoyable, & though it may not be my go-to game, it is still a favorite I return to often. The only minor thing I would like added, like some other people said as well, is a quick-reference of unit cost & upkeep.
Love this game
First game I bought when I switched from iPhone.  Insanely fun.
Fantastic game - now release Critical Mass for Android please!
Love this game and always will! I just miss the option to make your own maps and have different themes for the pieces!
My all time favorite phone game. Play for minutes or hours, and FINALLY (no offense, Sean) available for Android.

So, as a kid I found Slay on a PC demo disc. Ten years later, I'm psyched to find that Sean not only maintained Slay, but ported it to Android.  Some reviews claim "Very Hard" is impossible. Not true. It simply requires a change in strategy. Put off joining kingdoms until necessary, as huts provide essential defensive infrastructure. Keep your enemies equally strong, and they stay at each other's throats. The nuances go on, but "Slay" is a game that teaches you to think ahead and make no decision lightly.
Have had this title on every device. Great game.
Loved rats and critical mass. Critical mass was the first game I ever saved up to buy, lost the floppy disk with it on though. Been looking for it ever since.
Loved this game since my old win mobile days and palm pilot.

Played previously on iPhone.  Excellent game when was working  Now galaxy S5. Game has begun crashing on loading new maps for no reason after working well for 30ish rounds.  Reinstalling unhelpful. Broken üò•
Loved this game since my PocketPC!
Great game but really want to play with friends

It's an excellent strategy game.  Each map has it's own pace.  On the very hard maps, you have to grow at the expense to the right opponents.  Very tricky.  It sounds ridiculous but I've beat all the very hard maps- more please!
I bought this for the wondows pocket pc almost 15 years ago. I can't believe it's still around. I still have my old Windows version.
Had it on iphone years ago and I still enjoy it!

Title says it all. Loved the SLAY demo for Windows, and decided to look it up today. Saw it was TWENTY DOLLARS. That's just absolutely ridiculous. Saw an APP version, meaning i have some serious strategy to take with me on the go, and for only $3.88! That's much better. Not trying to be insulting, Mr. O'Connor, but that's a ridiculous price for the Windows version.  Still, glad to see this on Play. Gonna try it out now.
Great game.... When it isn't crashing.
Playing for chilling the last 2 weeks and I'm still at easy. Simple, yet great!
Crashes every time a map loads. Unplayable.
I've owned this game on every platform it's available on and it still does not get old. The harder levels are really tricky, the easy ones present a challenge of how fast you can do them.
Doesn't run on my N5, no updates for a few weeks, and giving up.

Fantastic game that depends solely on skill, not on luck.  Previous versions had some minor issues when exiting game (not saving/forgetting your history) but they seem pretty ironed out now. Well worth the time and money.
Hours of entertainment. Would love to see a more complex version of this game released.
Great game. Great for filling in and keeping me from getting board!

Epitome of easy to learn, hard to master. Very addicting, although after playing the crap out of it for a month or two I've run out of content. Multiplayer would help replay tremendously. Very much wish I was shown what territory I lost to computer with red-outlined hexes or something. Gotten better at remembering my boundaries but on big maps with more than a dozen territories its impossible to remember. Unit cost is on the help screen -- I still go there regularly to double check my math but there's no reason the app couldn't do that for me.
Ive been playing this since my father got it on one of his original palm pilots. Glad its still going. Very fun!
Thank you for making this on android. I remember playing this on Windows 95	Thank you for making this on android. I remember playing this on Windows 95
Simple but challenging. I'm addicted.

Challenging enough to keep trying but not hard enough to give up. Proof that games without great 3d gfx can still entertain. The only problem I have had was the loss of all my past wins. I've had to start over, trying to beat each map, several times.
How about some small sized challenge maps? Each could be like a puzzle with a specific solution to teach some of the game mechanics and strategies.  Otherwise great game!
An old favorite of mine

I use to play this on my iphone 4s! But so glad it's for android now. Plays super smooth and looks great on my larger screen on my note 2. Over 400 maps this game I've been playing for 3 years! Quick, fun, easy. But can we have the full zoom out when the AI makes their move like on iPhone plz?
Does what it sets out to do in a very clean and efficient manner.
Awesome. Many hours of playing.
...Of the Windows version... In my pocket!  I love it!   Please bring over Critical Mass next!

Wish they didn't change the old school rules. Played this game ages ago and villages couldn't protect against peasant capture. Make this an option and I'll bump to 5 stars. PS just found my original CD to this game

Risk meets chess. Been playing for years on various platforms. I love the challenge, it really makes you think. For those who say very hard is impossible I have lost 3 of 56 games so far :p  Would love to see some expanded options like volume control or custom colors for tiles. How about writing AI types defensive, aggressive, and cut,  to go with the current type and allow them to be randomly assigned for random turn lengths... extreme hard? The unpredictability would be fun.
Great game good way to pass some time

Perfect strategy game for mobiles, with levels taking just the right amount of time. Surprising numbers of strategies present themselves from such a simple mechanic. It is beautifully weighted and you can feel the care that has gone into the level design by Sean. Lots of entertainment here if you like turned based strategy games, and it is great value.
Old favorite on windows (3.11?). Still fun and works great on mobile.
I loved it years ago on the pocketpc and I still love it today on Android. Great game.

A splendid and well-balanced strategy game that's a bit like a combination of Risk and Go.  Hundreds and hundreds of maps of varying difficulty offer a new challenge with each game and great value for the money...I've played through at least a couple hundred so far, and I'm still having fun.  The rules are simple, but the gameplay surprisingly complex.  Overextend your empire, and you'll soon be dismantled...but rest on defense, and your foes will overwhelm you. Great game!
Good job with this game. Just like my childhood. However it is a huge battery drain... Don't know how it uses more battery than my screen
Had this way back in the 90's.  Thought about it ever since.  A timeless classic with no strings attached.

The play is simple but that's what makes it fun. The only problem is that it doesn't show what units you can make or how much money it needs to survive. This makes it harder to plan your attack strategy. If not for that, I would give it 5 out of 5 stars.
I have this for Windows and was over the moon to find it on Android. Bought it instantly and it's just like the Windows version. Superb!
I've been playing this game for over ten years, and the Android version is wonderful.  Simple, yet challenging enough to be interesting.  Now we just need some more maps.
This game tests your mind not your finger dexterity
Quite fun.

Ten years ago, this was the original multi-player game for the pocket PC.  There was an option for how many humans and you could pass the device around.  It would be nice to see that back.  The map in the corner is useless and I can barely see the little hut flags.  Making them larger would be great for us with bad eyes.

I have been playing Slay for well over 10 years. Started with PocketPC and then with Windows. What a surprise to see it on the Google market. Still like the windows version more (not sure if it is still sold). It has 5,000+ Friendly Games plus Challenge games.   Great strategy game, but simple and quick to play. Perfect for those 10-15 mins breaks. Could use crisper graphics like the windows version (don't like the texture graphics - Sean keep it simple). Wish your other games were on Android (Rats, Firefight, The General, Mother-of-all-battles, etc).

Decent strategy game, with minor issues of not being able to always find what moves are available on large maps. Wiuld be better if nen who csnt move are completed automatically, and very hard levels shiuld be renamed impossibly hard levels..
Games launches and then immediately crashes upon loading any map. This is a recent issue, not sure what is causing it. Shame, as prior to this I was really enjoying phasing the game.
replyContent:
Hi Murali,

please could you get in touch at sean@windowsgames.co.uk.  there have been no recent updates so this is wierd.

Thanks

Adrian

content: First game in a long time on phone thats had me casually playing when I get a minute. Basic concept but very engaging and only a one time cost =)
The only thing that would be better is Critical for Android!!!
Easy to learn, hard to beat at the hardest levels.  Each game is short, which is what I prefer. I enjoy playing it.
This looks and plays like an old Windows game.
Love this game
Wish there was a multiplayer mode.
I had bought the PC version of this forever ago and I was completely addicted.  I haven't played since I switched to Linux.  I LOVE YOU FOR MAKING THIS FOR ANDROID! !!!

I've been playing Sean O'Connor's Slay since 1996 when I first found it as a shareware game on a magazine cover disc!  Over the years, I must have played this game more than any other, and I'm delighted to see it as an app.  Very addictive, nicely challenging without being impossible, and a game to lose hours in playing.  Well worth the tiny price.
Somehow the zoom (Ghete hexagons get tiny on bigger maps) makes it difficult to play, but you can slide the map.
Thinking persons game.  If you like chess you probably would like this game.
Best game ever .
Had this game going back I bet 10 years ago on the WinMo platform.  Simple yet as addictive as ever and just as much fun. Trust me as it is great fun!
I've now played this game on three platforms and it doesn't get old. A great little strategy game, simple rules and can be very challenging on some maps.

I bought the "Windows Games" ten years or so ago when there were only 4 games in the bundle. I still keep my aging copies of Slay and Mother around for playing so was quite happy to spot this in the app store. I'd love to see Mother make an appearance as well.
Very simple and nice game. My favorite even since Windows Mobile 6
Originally simple, but still highly entertaining. Easy to pick up, and stay with!

Slay, on its own, is easily a 5 star game. And this is a very competent, well made version of Slay. I do have a few issues with this port, but keep in mind these are essentially the only faults I can think of, and Sean O'Connor seems to be doing a good job of making updates and fixes, so these might not even be issues by the time you read this (in which case I'll happily update my score to a 5). -Lack of visible information. Something that really helped when I was first learning the game on the PC was always visible unit costs, faction strengths, and the total wages of all units in a selected region. I understand that screen space is an issue on a mobile game, but I think not having that information visible up front could make the subtleties of the game harder to learn. -The sound is a little jarring. I like that the game uses the same sharp, loud shouts and trumpet sounds as the PC version, but I think an option to turn the volume down a little would be convenient (as opposed to having to adjust the device volume every time I start the game). It's a minor detail though. -The game chews through my battery like CRAZY.
Best game ever made. I played it on my pocket pc forever ago. Now I play it on my Galaxy Note 2 & Galaxy Note 3. The stylus makes it even better!
that you made this available on Android. I'm not an Apple fan but I kept my old Touch around just to play Slay.
If you back out to the map selection menu when you have a unit selected whenyou return the unit is gone. The undo button is also next to back button so i always hit it accidently. Major bummer
Love the game. Good stratagy game. Online play is needed. 2-6 online players battling it out on a larger board.
Great game
Used to play this all the time on pda's back in the day. Glad it is on a modern device once again!

I've bought and played this little gem on pretty much every platform that Sean has ever ported it to. The only thing missing from the Android/iOS version is pass-and-play multiplayer (my favorite game mode on the Pocket PC version). The game strikes an amazing balance between casual pick-up-and-play convenience and real strategic depth which keeps the player coming back for "just one more quick game" - or for a rematch on a map where you've been defeated. ("I'll get him this time!") Thanks again, Sean!

I love the game, and played it before when I had an iphone. However, this doesn't seem to work on my device and now I can't get a refund. I'll switch my rating to five stars if the game begins to work though.
replyContent:
Hi Ryan,

Please send an email to sean@windowsgames.co.uK, giving us the details of your device and the android version that you use.

Thanks Adrian.

content: Kept my pocket pc for the last 12 or so years just to play this game! Now Sean has finally ported it to android. I'm so happy. Easy to play, hard to put down. Brilliant turn based strategy.

An old Windows favourite, finally on Android and just as good as ever. My main suggestion is adding a quick reference to show cost & upkeep of each unit, lest you foolishly upgrade yourself to failure.

Used to play this on my old Palm Pilot and my Windows Mobile Phone. Great to find it on Android as well. Its simple yet addicting. My only complaint is that it can be a little glitchy when saving game progress.

This is the 4th platform where I've purchased this game.  I thought I was finally over it when I gave away my iPod, but no, I had to buy it again (and for more $ than last time) because it is one of my fav's.  Sean, my Slay addiction thanks you.  ;-)

I've been playing this game for more than a year on both the iPhone and now Samsung note. Challenging. Fun. Hours and hours of entertainment. The very hard maps are challenging but doable. Who wants a cakewalk - this is my favorite game of the past 2 years.
I've been playing Slay for years and it still has enough of a challenge. I'm a fan of Risk, but this is a much faster version that relies more on strategy opposed to a roll of the die.
Love the game, I wish there was an option to play against real people.

I first bought this game about 15 years ago for windows 95. It's one of my all time favourite games.  I was gutted when my old version wouldn't work on windows 7. I was overjoyed to find it on android.  I'd give it six stars if I could.
Great game, love it, it's brilliant. Its had bugs in the past, but I wanted to edit this review to say that stability problems have now been resolved and things are in good shape.
replyContent:
Hi Eric,

Please try updating.  The latest fixes the save game bug.  And also the help screen issue.

Thank for your patience,  Adrian

content: Played on pc before but this is ideal for touch screen.  Brilliant but simple strategy game.
The game starts easy and gets harder on each category
I played this game on windows mobile and couldn't wait for it to be released on android! Quick convenient gameplay with rich strategic depth. Mobile strategy at its finest!
Hadthis for pc. Awesome. Game
This has been on 3 phones now. I love it?

I love this addicting game but something that bothers me enough to take away two stars is how there are only two pages oh Hard games (which are challenging and very fun) but TWELVE pages of Very Hard, which I can't beat a single one! And trust me, I have tried. If there were more Hard games or if Very Hard weren't actually impossible, I'd rate it higher.
Of all the games I've played over my lifetime this is one of my favorites and I am so glad I can play one of my favorite games on my favorite system!  An oldie but a goody !!!
Good game. Still not sure exactly what the hexagon to peasant ratio, seems random, but I am stupid so probably not the case
Always a great time waster, no matter what platform.
Great game. Many different difficulty levels. Not sure if all levels are beatable but still trying! Well worth the money.
I love this game and im so glad they came out with it for the smart phone. Im a little sad that the saved data takes up over 100mb but this is one of the games i play most so its acceptable
Use to play this on windows 95.  Love this game, highly addictive.  Runs clean and fast on android. Hey Sean this would be epic if it were multiplayer with friends. . Just saying. .
I just like this game and find nothing wrong with it. Simple design. Works on my Nexus 5. Increasingly difficult. Take over the world. What's wrong with it?

Remains 5 stars as it is so many hours of ad-free fun for a very nominal cost. Buy it. I still play it a lot several months after install.  While it could still benefit more improvent. Developer does update. Edit: recent update both improved on game save and better starting screen.Jelly bean: I use to avoid some crashes by using home button and sleep game.
Simply compelling

This is an amazing game, but recent updates have detracted. Firstly, the animations are now much slower and the game lags a fair bit when scrolling the map. Second, when I try to resume a game that I started earlier, it returns the map to the original state, losing all my progress. Fix these, and I will re-rate to five stars.   Edit: reflashed my phone with stock firmware, and the lost progress issue is gone. Re-rated to 4 stars. The fifth is still forthcoming if the map lag is removed. Edit: and latest updates have removed the lagging and slow animations. Back to 5 stars!
A perfect game...
perfect game.
I've been playing this game since 1999. Never boring. :-)

been begging the author to release android version ever since I moved from iphone.  played this every day I had the iphone.  so many challenging levels.,, I see improvements in this version.  I approve!

Dear Sean, you really need to start doing Q&A on your game. Usually you polish the game before release, not after.  - Pressing help/info crashes the game every time - You have obviously never tested the game on a extra high resolution device (xxhdpi). Go ahead and remove support for those devices from your manifest file right now and perform an update (I am very serious).
replyContent:
Hi Ernir.

Please try updating to the new version.  It ought to fix a lot of the issues you have encountered.

Thanks for your feedback, and for your patience.

Adrian.

content: Awesome game for hardcore strategists. Played it till 5AM last night and again as soon as I woke up. Simple rules with incredible depth. Only issue was that help does not work on my Nexus 7.
I live this game. Simple yet fun strategy game.

It is crazy that a game I paid money for has no consistent way to save.   Sometimes when I come back to the app, it is where I left off, but often it just restarts the board which is super frustrating!
Coococ
Play it when I have 30 mins to kill. AI is smart, but still able to beat. Maps have plenty of variety.  If you like strategy, its a good game.

is nice, like it... but... no multiplayer? and i notice many nice android games dont have multiplayer. is it hard to program or reason? and still some progress loss.  also does anybody know if ironfell is a similar game like slay? i cant join ironfell for accounts are full
Got this back in 1998 on some shareware CD, now nearly 14 years later it's still great and highly addictive.
Although I wish they had an option to fight for water territory.

I have played Slay on Pocket PC,  and PC.  Very pleased to see it on Android!  I have had a few problems with the Android version. It keeps disappearing from my Galaxy S2 and i have to reinstall it.  Also it wont run at all on my Nook HD+

I first bought this for Palm V, then for Windows 95, then for my iPod Touch. Just started playing again on my iPod and looked to see if it had been ported yet - great news to see it had been. Not 5 stars because you can't dismiss enemy surrender, and the graphics for the map selection page and overview map in the corner during game play are not quite as easy to see as on the iOS version. Paid for it, though, in hopes that development will continue for Android.
5 star game play with a 1 star interface... Only because it closes the game when someone calls or texts and loses progress
Like others, been playing this since way back in the PocketPC days! Love that it's on And!

A great turn based Risk-style game, Slay is simple to understand, but challenging enough for replay on later boards. It's a great casual game for killing time.   My only complaint is this doesn't make use of the Android UI guidelines for things like the back button.
Installed on Nook HD+ (BNTV600, software version 2.1.1). App stops immediately on launch, no reason given. Sent mail to Sean, no response.

Been playing (and, uh, pirating) this on my PC for what seems like forever. Finally ponied up the money to buy it on Android. The AI isn't as good as on PC but it's still loads of fun. Best on a large screen, so I prefer playing it on my Nexus 7. One downside: it really kills the battery on my Note II, even with a big extended battery.
A great classic! Extremely good fun. Great idea. Would love to see graphics upped to high quality though. Recommended if you like simple turn based strategy.
Awesome game, been a fan for ages across platforms, this version just needs save game state for when your device sleeps or u get a phone call, having to start a level over sux
Nice to see the game for android
This is great game I used to play on Win 98. It would definitly benfit from a random map mode or online vs match.

This is a great game! Lots of fun strategy, and tons of levels to play through at varying difficulty. However, there is no way to save your progress in the middle of a level and the level resets if you leave the game before finishing it. It even often resets the level when the screen locks, which is very frustrating as you can lose all your progress if you want to take a break or even if your screen just times out from inactivity while you are thinking about your next move. Need that fixed and a save option

I love this game. Great one for strategists like me. One thing I would like to see is a way to save progress. I was nearly finished a map and sat my phone down for a moment. Lost all my progress when the phone timed out. Very sad, this my only peeve. Fix this and the game will be perfect.
Timeless strategy.  Not mind-numbing.

I remember playing this on Pocket PC back long before Android existed. There have been a couple of knockoffs in the Play Store, but it's great to see that the original is here now.  One of the best abstract strategy games I've ever played, and totally worth the money.
One of my favorite games
Used to play this game all the time back in middle school. So awesome to have it on Android! It gets sluggish at times on my Galaxy Nexus, but otherwise it's great!
Always loved this game.  Nice to have it on my phone now.  I've lost many mindless hours to this game on PC.  Insanely addictive.
I like this game a lot and have it on a few devices, but it would be great if you could make it a bit clearer on whether or not you had enough resources to support your population.
The game itself is fun but I want pass and play! The creator will not add pass and play unless he sells more but the price is outrageous to anybody who has never played the game so they won't buy.
Interesting little strategy game. Difficulty progression is a little slow, but major flaw is no save function.

I really like this game, but I have two issues that will make me play it less often. Locking the screen or launching an other application causes me to lose my progress on the current island. This makes casual gameplay on the bus or coffee break at work impossible, which is a pity. Second, the app drains battery and heats up my SG Note II more than other apps which makes me think twice to start a game if i am short on power.

If it wasn't seriously imperiling my productivity, I wouldn't have had to force myself to uninstall it. That said, uninstalling does cause the phone to reboot. So, aside from that minor quibble, give Sean your money already! Your boss will hate him for it.

Wow... Played this over 10 years ago on my PC. So glad to find a version on here that is both true to the original and improved. Many thanks Sean! Now, how about porting some of your other games to Android?
Really... really good game. 'Nuff said!

This one of my favourite game of all times. I've played it a lot on my pocket pc, on my desktop and now on my android. There are some flaws in saving progress of the level, but that is minor problem. The game is awesome.
Best game ever. Addictive.

I had this on my HP iPAQ and I loved it...still do.  Awesome game.  My only complaint is if you get a call or have to goto the home screen you lose everything you did that game. Please make it so it saves your in game progress so you don't have to start over and then this is definitely a 5 star game.
Super fun. Glad to have it on Android now.
But crashes all the time on non stock roms. Sgs3

I played this game for years on my Pocket PC. I'm really glad it finally became an Android app.  Intially a bit of a battery drain but 1 of the updates fixed that and it's really great to play now.  Plenty of maps at all difficulty levels.

Long before cell phones became "smart" I used to play this game on a device called a "Pocket PC" which was like a smartphone without the phone part. Now that I have a smartphone and Pocket PC's are long gone, I am excited to find this great strategy game available for Android. The game is well worth the small amount it costs. If you want to try to game style before you pay, visit the developers website for a Windows demo of the game. By the way, I have not had any problems saving my games. Simply hitting the Back button when I need to take a break takes you back to the menu and saves your game automatically.
Been waiting years for a pour to Android,  and it's well worth it!   Seriously addictive!

This game is exactly like the PC version.  it has a smooth interface, familiar graphics, and the option to change the colors. The AI scales just like the PC version as well. Highly recommended it, if you enjoyed the PC version.

This game is great and I love it!! It would be really nice if their was an option to choose your color just like in the PC version. So you don't have to be stuck as red all the time. . . As soon as that feature comes out. It will be the best game!

I've been a fan of this game for as long as I can remember, having played it on PC, Palm and now Android. I installed 1.0.5 a few days ago, and was immediately unimpressed with the speed of reaction to user input, the slow animations and the way the current game does not save. I have a feeling something needs to come out of the implementation in order to make it playable again.  Got the update to 1.0.7 and the game still doesn't save. I've got my fingers crossed for another update soon, because this really is a cracker, addictive game otherwise.  *** Update *** I now have a Galaxy Tab 2 and the game performs really well AND saves progress. There may be an issue with certain sound effects. Upgrading from 3 to 4 stars.
Love the game but many levels unfinished cause frozen

I have played slay on pc for many years. The game itself is fantastic. However I am so far unimpressed with this version. There are problems when locking the phone during game play which result in force closing and then losing your saved game. Also one of my islands now force closes every time I open it and no way to clear it out. Please fix this game....I really do love it.
addictive game!
Simple, Fun, Worth it.

Pocket Slay was my favorite game on Pocket PC. Unfortunately this version crashes every time my phone locks and since there is no save game i have to start over. It is not acceptable for a payed app! Fix it and you'll have my five stars.
I've been waiting for Slay on Android for well over 4 years. It has been worth the wait. Great time waster. If you like strategy games, get this game!
Game is fun when it doesn't force close. Also I'm fairly certain that since the new AI patch several levels became unbeatable due to map advantage.
Needs to do a better job saving progress.  Current design requires you to restart whenever the phone sleeps.  You lose all progress, and it sucks!
Very good!

I LOVE this game and bought the app, but it keeps force-closing on my phone. :( I've only been able to finish 2 out of 4 games, disappointing. My phone is a Samsung SGH-T589R.  My other suggestion to the developers would be to really really work on speed. It runs slowly and this aspect of gameplay is quite frustrating when compared to the PC version.  After that they can work on the little things that could really make this shine. :)
Works very well, too addictive.

The concept's great, and the AI is appropriately tough.  It could become a great game.  Its greatest issue is performance; it does not look like a game that should run slowly on any phone, let alone one with relatively modern specs (HTC One S).  I assume it's a port from iOS, but for a higher price I think it'd be reasonable to give the Android version a bit more optimization work.  There are some little things that aren't at all necessary but would make it easier to get into: giving soldiers a bit of faction color for identification, giving you more time to see what the enemy is doing to you, an explanation of the buttons along the bottom, and above all, not telling us there's a peasant who can move when there isn't an available space for him to move to!  Despite all that, it's one of the most interesting turn-based games for Android.
Game will still not save and reopen to the last played turn when application is closed. Forced to restart from turn one.
I have updated game but Titanium Backup shows me that I still have 1.0.7, why?  And why I cant resume the game even after I unlock phone. The game starts from the begin but I want to continue :(

Ingenious little territory-taking game with economic and military elements that could hardly be any simpler. AI improved with update and is much more aggressive. I wish the Undo button were not right by the Android back button.
Great simpls game but needs game saves.
I used to love this on pc. But surely this version is much easier? (I don't think I've got much cleverer.) Much too easy to beat AI on 'very hard'.
Needs asynchronous multiplayer! Will be amazing and I would recommend it to others

I have played this game for years. Found this in the early years on PC and Sean supports this game 100%!  I have bought Windows, PocketPC, itunes and now Android versions!  Was worried it wasn't coming to Android and when I found it, I did not hesitate to buy because I know if there are bugs, Sean will fix it!
Great game, but crashes randomly and makes maps unplayable.
Please implement multiplayer with/without bots. The ai is too easy to beat on the hardest setting. And I want to play against my brother. Thanks.
I've bought this game on pc, iOS, and android. Worth it every time.
Perfect simple strategy game! I was playing this in PC before about 15 years ago! ‚Ä¶
Finally!  This is a great game.  Long awaited.  Well worth the price!
My favorite mobile strategy game from iPhone made it to my Android replacement!  Thank you, thank you!
This is the best blend of features on a casual game, for me.  Lots of different maps, predictable but unexpected complexity, and I can jump in and play when I want for as long as I want.

They did a excellent job porting Slay to Android, it plays really well. Happily the developers decided to keep the game free of 'In App Purchases' and Ads, so you get a full game without limitations for your money. Slay is worth every penny. Its a great game. Very simple to learn and highly motivating.  BTW: I had a lot of force closes with older Versions but 1.0.5 runs fine on my Galaxy Note.

I've loved this game for many years now on other platforms and the Android version does full justice to the game.  Easy to learn and hard to master, simple rules but complex scenarios.  This is a perfectly designed game.
The best yet simplest strategy game there is. Easy to learn hard to master.
Find myself playing this game every moment of downtime. Developer has fixed every bug I've reported in the initial release.
Don't work
This is a great game to think about whilst pooping. It really gets your brain working as your bowels are.
I am a huge fan of turn based strategy games and this is a top quality piece of work. Simple to play, challenging to master, and with a very slick UI. Bravo, and keep it coming!
Don't updat it will not work and can you add a palyer slect like on pc

Asus Nexus 7  Works flawlessly. Deceptively simple but great depth underneath...like GO in that regard. Easily the winner of the most fun 'across all platforms' game out there.   The latest bug fix made the men jump more slowly though so they're harder to notice, which is important sometimes.
finally. Play this game almost every day for years......finally in my pocket Developer needs to update for bug causing frequent force close..am emailing
I wish replaying the level took the lowest record score
Used to play this on my palm. Unfortunately it gives an in stall error code (500) then proceeds to install but force closes on opening.  Asus Transformer Infinity
Just as great as when I was s kid!

Great game. Graphics could be better and trees grow faster than I remember. Worth the price, but would do better at a lower price. Particularly with the graphic quality where it is.  But, still worth the price.

I am new to this game. Finding the difficulty about right. The button with two arrows is confusing me. Also if you white flag to stop the level gets stuck on that, no option to start again. Overall I'm enjoying it, no crashes, worth getting.

I love Slay, it's probably one of my favourite strategy games - on any platform. Been waiting ages for it to appear on Android. My only grumble would be with the price, too high compared to the rest of the market. For almost ¬£4 I'd be expecting better graphics and multiplayer.

I loved this game on my PC and had been hoping this would come out on android for ages. I haven't been disappointed at all! Great gameplay with tons of replay value. It may be more expensive than other games, but remember this is an independent developer not a big game studio and clearly a lot of work has gone into it. Hopefully a free demo version will be made to help entice new players to try this.

Great game I use to play on PocketPC and Win9x/XP  Has a challenge, addictive, and a great time killer.  Worth the price since it is a quality game and the developer actually responds to you on a personal basis if you run into a problem or have a suggestion.
I loved this game on my windows PDA. Good to see it on Android at last. Any chance of adding the extra voice packs?
Thanks a ton. It plays very smoothly on my Motorola Xoom tablet. Well worth the purchase.

This is a very fun and interesting turn based strategy game.  It's simple to learn but complex enough to remain interesting.  If it didn't constantly crash, it's easily be a five star game, but until it gets fixed it's nigh unplayable.
Thanks for helping move from apple to google
I have been missing this game since I got rid of my iPhone. Awesome job on the first version.
Worth the wait
Fun and addicting on any platform. I have been playing this since Windows 95 and it is good to see it on Android finally!
I have been playing the PC version of this game for years- amazing game!  Deep strategy that you can play for five minutes or a few hours.
I own all of Sean's games.  All are good, but Slay is just great.  Works great on my N7.
Really pleased to finally get this on android. Works really well on my Nexus S and Motorola Xoom
Waiting a loooonng time for this.  Works well on all my devices.  Well worth the money.

Slay is a wonderfully simple turn-based strategy game. The rules of the game are very simple, but mastering the game is very hard.   Sean O'Connor has released the game on Windows, WinCE, iOS and now it's been done for Android.  The leveling of the levels on the iOS and now Android version has been done very well. Players can start on the easier levels and then play the more difficult ones gradually.   For anyone who wants a challenging turn based strategy game Slay is heartily recommended.
